user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
- test_code: a modified lfs_dir_rewind code that contains useful probe functions that print useful logs to a file "/tmp/logs/286.txt". The logs should contain the control path and state information of the violation scenario. If the MISRA C rule is not violated, you can just return an empty string for the test code.
Here are the constraints for the test code:
- DO NOT introduce new violations to demonstrate your scenario.
- The test code MUST be compilable and executable.
- The test code MUST include line breaks.
- The test code MUST preserve the original logic of lfs_dir_rewind as much as possible.
- You MUST NOT define the main function.
- You MUST NOT define macros.
- The test code MUST not contain any mock functions.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_dir_rewind:
```c
int lfs_dir_rewind(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_rewind(%p, %p)", (void*)lfs, (void*)dir);

    err = lfs_dir_rewind_(lfs, dir);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_rewind -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function lfs_dir_rewind:
static int lfs_dir_rewind_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir) {
    // reload the head dir
    int err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &dir->m, dir->head);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    dir->id = 0;
    dir->pos = 0;
    return 0;
}
...
static int lfs_dir_fetch(lfs_t *lfs,
        lfs_mdir_t *dir, const lfs_block_t pair[2]) {
    // note, mask=-1, tag=-1 can never match a tag since this
    // pattern has the invalid bit set
    return (int)lfs_dir_fetchmatch(lfs, dir, pair,
            (lfs_tag_t)-1, (lfs_tag_t)-1, NULL, NULL, NULL);
}
...
static int lfs_dir_fetch(lfs_t *lfs,
        lfs_mdir_t *dir, const lfs_block_t pair[2]) {
    // note, mask=-1, tag=-1 can never match a tag since this
    // pattern has the invalid bit set
    return (int)lfs_dir_fetchmatch(lfs, dir, pair,
            (lfs_tag_t)-1, (lfs_tag_t)-1, NULL, NULL, NULL);
}
</additional code>
Judge whether the above lfs_dir_rewind code violates the rule 21.14 or not.
scenario: The provided lfs_dir_rewind implementation and the shown callees (lfs_dir_rewind_, lfs_dir_fetch) do not call memcmp or perform comparisons of null-terminated strings. No use of memcmp is present in the given code, so MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is not violated.
